required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Retrospective Observational Study to Describe Anaemia Management, Burden of Disease and Outcomes in Chinese Patients on Peritoneal Dialysis Using a Clinical Database
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Observational Study to Describe Anaemia Management, Burden of Disease and Outcomes in Chinese Patients on Peritoneal Dialysis Using a Clinical Database

brief_summary.textblock: The overall objective is to describe the epidemiology, health care resource utilisation (HCRU) and selected clinical outcomes in patients initiating PD by anaemia status in real-world setting in China.

primary_outcome.description: prevalence and incidence based on Hb values
the number and percentage of patients who experienced as all-cause hospitalisations.
modified MACE (all-cause mortality or major cardiovascular events)

secondary_outcome.measure: Hb and ESA dose trajectories in Chinese PD patients with evidence of inflammation (via c-reactive protein [CRP] and highly sensitive CRP) and post-ESA initiation.

study_pop.textblock: This study is primarily descriptive and all patients meeting the inclusion criteria will be included. We expect to analysis data on approximately 2000 to 2500 peritoneal dialysis patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged ≥14 years at the initiation of peritoneal dialysis
- Patients with CKD with the first treatment/initiation of peritoneal dialysis between 1 June 2016 and 31 December 2017 with up to 2 years of follow-up data.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with missing age or sex information (proportion of missingness to be assessed)
- Patients with diagnosis of any cancer (except for non-melanoma skin cancer) within 12 months prior to and inclusive of the baseline date
- Patients with evidence of active bleeding within 30 days and inclusive of the baseline date
- Patients with peritoneal dialysis switched from hemodialysis or renal transplantation failure
- Individuals receiving temporary PD (duration < 30 days) because of acute kidney injury.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Clinical Professor in Renal Division，Department of Medicine
